channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MT

item.title: Report E-2025070104
item.description:
Report E-2025070104

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-01
  • City: Billings
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: BELLE CHEMICAL LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 07/01/2025 at approximately 1428, David Terry reported an undeclared dangerous good. The shipment consisted of a plastic container packaged in a fiberboard box. The commodity was identified as acetic acid solution with not less than 50% but not more than 80% acid, and it was not prepared in accordance with DOT HMR Regulations. Per the agent, this shipper has repeatedly attempted to ship this package, which lead to further inspection. The package is being held, pending DOT investigation. The shipper confirmed by provision of the safety data sheet, the shipment is not less than 50% acid, and is over the 1 liter limited quantity.

  • Description: On 06/26/2025 at approximately 1320, David Terry reported an undeclared dangerous good. The shipment consisted of a plastic container packaged in a fiberboard box. The commodity was identified as acetic acid solution with 99% concentration, and it was not prepared in accordance with DOT HMR Regulations. Per the agent, this shipper has repeatedly attempted to ship this package, which lead to further inspection. The package is being held, pending DOT investigation. The shipper confirmed by provision of the safety data sheet, the shipment is 99% acetic acid.

item.title: Report X-2025070439
item.description:
Report X-2025070439

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-24
  • City: BILLINGS
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: GROUND HAZMAT PACKAGE DISCOVERED LEAKING. I WAS CALLED TO INVESTIGATE A WET PACKAGE AND NOTICED THAT SEVERAL OTHER PACKAGES WERE LOADED ON TOP OF THIS PACKAGE. THERE WAS MINIMAL LEAKAGE AND I TANSPORTED THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP AREA FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2025070466
item.description:
Report X-2025070466

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-11
  • City: HAVRE
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PPRX 170380 was noted in the BNSF Havre yard to be leaking crude oil from the protective housing. Upon opening the housing lid, the leak was noted as coming from the stem of the needle valve for the sample line. The packing gland nut was found to be loose. The packing gland nut was tightened, and the leak stopped. Car is awaiting an OTMA for movement.
